description: Binary classification model to predict violent vs non-violent incidents using time-aware validation and tree-based models.
limitations: Severe class imbalance (~9.5% violent) can cause models to under-predict the minority class unless explicitly calibrated/weighted.
Geographic coverage limited to Philadelphia; performance may not generalize to other cities.
Temporal drift is likely; retraining and monitoring should be performed on a regular cadence.
Features are limited to those available at dispatch time (no investigation outcomes).
SHAP analysis is computationally expensive; use sampling for explanation workflows.
usage_recommendations: Use for aggregate planning and resource allocation, not individual profiling.
Monitor minority-class metrics (violent precision/recall) and calibrate thresholds.
Consider class-weighting, resampling, or threshold tuning if violent recall is low.
Re-evaluate performance quarterly and after major policy or reporting changes.
